metadata.title: CVE-2018-3646 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and addresstranslations may allow unauthorized disclosure of information residing inthe L1 data cache to an attacker with local user access with guest OSprivilege via a terminal page fault and a side-channel analysis.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3646` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20180807a.0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-133-generic - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-4.4.0-133-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-4.4.0-133-lowlatency - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-4.4.0-133-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-4.4.0-133-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-4.4.0-133-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-4.4.0-133-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-133-generic - 4.4.0-133.159
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1065-aws - 4.4.0-1065.75
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-32-generic - 4.15.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-32-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-32-lowlatency - 4.15.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-32-generic - 4.15.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-32-lowlatency - 4.15.0-32.35~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1021-azure - 4.15.0-1021.21~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1017-gcp - 4.15.0-1017.18~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1031-kvm - 4.4.0-1031.37
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20180807a.0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-133.159').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1065.75').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-32.35~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1021.21~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1017.18~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1031.37').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
